overview_of_class: This course focuses on the educational needs of exceptional children as designated by the Federal law, Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. This includes children with cognitive and developmental disabilities, hearing and visual impairments, learning disabilities, speech and language disabilities, behavior and emotional disabilities, physical and health impairments, autism, traumatic brain injury, and multiple and severe impairments. Laws mandating special education are examined. Educational issues, including philosophies of evaluation, placement, intervention , accommodations and the use of technology are addressed. The role of the exceptional child in the context of family, school, peers and community is examined. Special education issues, as they relate to society as a whole, are discussed.
name: The Field of Special Education
